DataElement.preferredName: Prior Therapy Prothrombin Time International Normalized Ratio of Prothrombin Time Assessment Ind-3b
DataElement.preferredDefinition: an indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or not applicable related to pretreatment assessment of the measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin and a ratio that represents the prothrombin time for a plasma specimen, divided by the result for a control plasma specimen, further standardized for the International Sensitivity Index of the tissue factor (thromboplastin).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Prior Therapy Prothrombin Time International Normalized Ratio of Prothrombin Time Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to pretreatment assessment of the measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin and a ratio that represents the prothrombin time for a plasma specimen, divided by the result for a control plasma specimen, further standardized for the International Sensitivity Index of the tissue factor (thromboplastin).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

A measurement of the clotting time of plasma recalcified in the presence of excess tissue thromboplastin; it is a measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. It is used to determine the clotting tendency of blood, in the measure of warfarin dosage, liver damage and vitamin K status. Factors measured are fibrinogen, prothrombin, and factors V, VII, and X.

Property.preferredName: International Normalized Ratio of Prothrombin Time Assessment
Property.preferredDefinition: A ratio that represents the prothrombin time for a plasma specimen, divided by the result for a control plasma specimen, further standardized for the International Sensitivity Index of the tissue factor (thromboplastin) used in the test.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.longName: International Normalized Ratio of Prothrombin Time
Concepts.definition: A measure of the extrinsic pathway of coagulation. The International Normalized Ratio of Prothrombin Time (INR) is the ratio of a patient prothrombin time to a normal (control) sample raised to the power of the International Sensitivity Index (ISI) with a range of 0.8 to 1.2 seconds.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Are the pre-treatment PT/PT I
ReferenceDocuments.description: Are the pre-treatment PT/PT INR/PTT results available

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on Coumadin, is the patient's international normalized ratio (INR) and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) greater than 1.5 x ULN?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient is on Coumadin, is the patient's international normalized ratio (INR), prothrombin time (PT), and partial thromboplastin time (PTT) greater than 1.5 x ULN?
